title: There's almost no benefit to having first two picks in champ select
body:
The only benefit is you can pick for a teammate but it's so rare that you get people to talk in champ select because everyone is a wannabe streamer and decides they'll go play another game while champ select is going on. 

You always end up getting counterpicked, you don't even get a say in what's banned. Sure, you can ask but good luck because again, getting someone to be responsive in champ select is like pulling teeth. Honestly, top two picks should be awarded 1-2 more LP if they are queuing up solo. That might not seem like a lot but that LP does add-up, especially to help prevent dicking you over from the infamous 99LP. 

I don't know, I don't have a viable answer but having first two picks sucks really bad right now. Have fun getting counterpicked in top and getting rolled if you're first two picks.

While Mordekaiser is probably subject to being cheesed by Tryndamere at level 2 if he's not careful (everyone is, even guys like Darius), is Tryndamere really a hard match-up? He's so predictable and has to eat your harass for free. And if you rush sunfire cape (like I do) you will have the armour to fuck him. Though I can't imagine even a Mordekaiser who is building to counter Tryndamere can 1v1 him at a certain point. 

And Jax? Really? I've done that lane once and it was honestly one of the easiest of my life. I guess you could suggest that the Jax was bad, but fact of the matter is that I out-damaged him purely stat-wise and out-tanked him. I even disrespected him by taking scaling MR (because fuck his W and ult passive) instead of flat. I think this might have also been the game I accidentally took Strength of the Ages. How can he respond to your harass without sheepishly taking it or getting zoned, especially given that his E has a much longer cooldown than any of your abilities?
